titleInfo.title: 'Rough Sketch of the Peninsula on which Bushire is situated Shewing the Landing Place and Different Positions of the Force. From the 7th to the 10th Dec. 1856, when the Place Surrendered'

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:540 x 701 mm, on sheet 419 x 440 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Calcutta, Lithographed by H.M. Smith at the Surveyor Generals Office.Distinctive Features:Shows the position of the British fleet on the 6th of December 1856; of boats landing troops under cover of the gun boats and fleet on the 7th Dec. 1856 and the position of force near the village of Ras Hallilah (Haleylah), with references.Inscriptions:Signed by John Hill, Major, Commanding Engineer Persian Field Force.
